clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Pain Neuroscience Education on Patients With Arthroscopic Rotator Cuff Repair
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Pain Neuroscience Education on Patients With Arthroscopic Rotator Cuff Repair

brief_summary.textblock: During the rehabilitation process after rotator cuff repair surgery, patients suffer from increased pain and discomfort due to dysfunction. Pain neuroscience education, a more modern educational method, has been reported to be effective in controlling pain by reducing the fear of movement based on an understanding of neurophysiology.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change in pain intensity from baseline to weeks 2, 4, and 6
primary_outcome.description: A numeric pain rating scale (NPRS) consisting of 11 points in total from 0 points (no pain) to 10 points (the most severe pain imaginable) is used. The lower the score, the less the pain.

arm_group.arm_group_label: pain neuroscience education plus rotator cuff repair rehabilitation

intervention.description: Neurophysiological education of pain allows patients to explore a wider contribution to pain through the knowledge that pain is often an unreliable indicator of the extent or extent of tissue damage. This aims at reconceptualization from biomedical or structural models to actual biological psychosocial pain models.
intervention.arm_group_label: pain neuroscience education plus rotator cuff repair rehabilitation

intervention.description: Postoperative rehabilitation programs include thermal therapy, electrical therapy, manual therapy, and therapeutic exercise.
intervention.arm_group_label: pain neuroscience education plus rotator cuff repair rehabilitation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults over 18 years old
- In case of 4 weeks after receiving arthroscopic rotator cuff repair
- If you wish to participate in research
Exclusion Criteria:
- 65 years old or older
- Those who are limited in conducting education remotely
- If the tear area is large and augmentation is performed
- If there is a previous surgical history at the surgical site
- Osteoarthritis in the shoulder joint
- If you cannot understand the guidelines for evaluation or intervention
- Mental health and cognitive problems
